snippet: The state is thriving economically from the oil drilling, but its senators are concerned after several accidents.
abstract: North Dakota state officials are putting pressure on Obama administration to improve railroad safety regulations, with some even urging slowdown in oil drilling until solutions are found; state is thriving economically from the drilling, but its senators are concerned after several recent accidents.

byline.original: By CLIFFORD KRAUSS and MATTHEW L. WALD

lead_paragraph: The state is thriving economically from the oil drilling, but its senators are concerned after several accidents.

headline.main: After Accidents, North Dakota Senators Want Stiffer Rail Safety Rules
headline.print_headline: After Accidents, North Dakota Senators Want Stiffer Rail Safety Rules
